clinical_study.brief_title: Drug Outcome Survey for Biological Treatments in Rheumatoid Arthritis: an Observational Study (Dose)
clinical_study.official_title: Drug Outcome Survey for Biological Treatments in Rheumatoid Arthritis: an Observational Study

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this observational study is to describe and define the current daily practice of management of anti-TNF-agents in Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA) patients. Data will be collected only from subjects providing informed consent.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Disease Activity Score Based on 28-joints Count (DAS28) Remission at Month 3
primary_outcome.description: DAS28 calculated from the SJC and PJC using the 28 joints count, the ESR (mm/hr) and PtGA of disease activity (participant rated arthritis activity assessment with transformed scores ranging 0 to 10; higher scores indicated greater affectation due to disease activity). DAS28 less than or equal to (<=) 3.2 = low disease activity, DAS28 greater than (>) 3.2 to 5.1 = moderate to high disease activity. A participant is considered to be in remission if they have a DAS28 less than (<) 2.6.

primary_outcome.measure: Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR) at Month 3
primary_outcome.description: ESR is a laboratory test that provides a non-specific measure of inflammation. The test assesses the rate at which red blood cells fall in a test tube. Normal range is 0-30 mm/hr. A higher rate is consistent with inflammation.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Anti-cyclic Citrullinated Protein (Anti-CCP) Antibodies at Month 3
primary_outcome.description: Anti-CCP antibodies are auto antibodies (antibodies directed against 1 or more of an individual's own proteins) that are frequently detected in the blood of rheumatoid arthritis participants. Anti-CCP antibodies value higher than 10 U/mL is considered positive.

primary_outcome.measure: Duration of Morning Stiffness at Month 3
primary_outcome.description: Duration of morning stiffness: Time elapsed when participant woke up in morning and was able to resume normal activities without stiffness in minutes. Increase in stiffness duration from baseline represented disease progression and/or joint worsening, no change represented halting of disease progression, and a decrease represented improvement.

primary_outcome.measure: Stanford Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ) Score at Month 3
primary_outcome.description: HAQ is a measure of functional limitations. Participants were rated on 4 point scale with scores: 0=no difficulty (normal), 1=some difficulty (adequate), 2=much difficulty (limited), 3=unable to do based on degree of difficulty experienced with 20 tasks grouped into 8 areas of dressing, rising, hygiene, reach, walking, eating, grip and activities. The higher score reported by the participant for any component question of the 8 categories determines the score for that categories. Total score is divided for 8. Average score range: 0 (no difficulty) to 3 (unable to do).

primary_outcome.measure: Stanford Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ) Score at Month 6
primary_outcome.description: HAQ is a measure of functional limitations. Participants were rated on 4 point scale with scores: 0=no difficulty (normal), 1=some difficulty (adequate), 2=much difficulty (limited), 3=unable to do based on degree of difficulty experienced with 20 tasks grouped into 8 areas of dressing, rising, hygiene, reach, walking, eating, grip and activities. The higher score reported by the participant for any component question of the 8 categories determines the score for that categories. Total score is divided for 8. Average score range: 0 (no difficulty) to 3 (unable to do).

The higher score reported by the participant for any component question of the 8 categories determines the score for that categories. Total score is divided for 8. Average score range: 0 (no difficulty) to 3 (unable to do).

primary_outcome.measure: Stanford Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ) Score at Month 12
primary_outcome.description: HAQ is a measure of functional limitations. Participants were rated on 4 point scale with scores: 0=no difficulty (normal), 1=some difficulty (adequate), 2=much difficulty (limited), 3=unable to do based on degree of difficulty experienced with 20 tasks grouped into 8 areas of dressing, rising, hygiene, reach, walking, eating, grip and activities. The higher score reported by the participant for any component question of the 8 categories determines the score for that categories. Total score is divided for 8. Average score range: 0 (no difficulty) to 3 (unable to do).

primary_outcome.measure: 36-Item Short-Form Health Survey (SF-36) at Month 12
primary_outcome.description: SF-36 is a standardized survey evaluating 8 aspects of functional health and well being: physical and social functioning, physical and emotional role limitations, bodily pain, general health, vitality, mental health. The score for a section is an average of the individual question scores, which are scaled 0-100 (100=highest level of functioning).

secondary_outcome.description: Direct costs included all expenses requiring actual payment or time spent due to the disease itself or to disability.
Indirect costs represent the loss of resources as a consequence of work disability or unemployment.

group.title: Anti-tumor Necrosis Factor (Anti-TNF) Agents
group.description: Participants with rheumatoid arthritis (RA) prescribed with anti-TNF agents (etanercept, adalimumab, infliximab) as per investigator’s discretion were observed for a period of 12 months.

group.title: Anti-tumor Necrosis Factor (Anti-TNF) Agents
group.description: Participants with rheumatoid arthritis (RA) prescribed with anti-TNF agents (etanercept, adalimumab, infliximab) as per investigator’s discretion were observed for a period of 12 months.

measure.title: Age, Customized

class.title: Greater than or equal to (>=) 65 years

measure.title: Gender
Percentage of participants with Disease Activity Score Based on 28-joints count (DAS28) remission
measure.description: DAS28 calculated from the number of swollen joints (SJC) and painful joints (PJC) using the 28 joints count, the ESR and PtGA of disease activity. DAS28 <=3.2 = low disease activity, DAS28 >3.2 to 5.1 = moderate to high disease activity. A participant is considered to be in remission if they have a DAS28 <2.6.

measure.title: Disease Activity Score Based on 28-joints count (DAS28)
measure.description: DAS28 calculated from the SJC and PJC using the 28 joints count, the ESR and PtGA of disease activity. DAS28 <=3.2 = low disease activity, DAS28 >3.2 to 5.1 = moderate to high disease activity. Number of participants analyzed (N)=272 for this parameter.

measure.title: Patient Global Assessment (PtGA)
measure.description: PtGA measured using a 10 cm Visual Analog Scale (VAS) ranging from 0 cm = very good to 10 cm = very bad.

measure.title: Physician Global Assessment (PGA)
measure.description: PGA was measured on a 0 to 10 cm VAS, with 0 cm = no disease activity to 10 cm = worst disease activity possible.

measure.title: Visual Analogue Scale for Pain (VAS-pain)
measure.description: 10 cm line (VAS) marked by participant. Intensity of pain range: 0 cm = no pain to 10 cm = worst possible pain.

measure.title: C-reactive Protein (CRP)
measure.description: CRP is a marker of inflammation. CRP value higher than 0.5 mg/dL is consistent with inflammation. Number of participants analyzed (N) = 272 for this parameter.

measure.title: Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR)
measure.description: ESR is a laboratory test that provides a non-specific measure of inflammation. The test assesses the rate at which red blood cells fall in a test tube. Normal range is 0-30 mm/hr. A higher rate is consistent with inflammation.

measure.title: Rheumatoid Factor (RF)
measure.description: RF is the auto antibody directed against immunoglobulin G (IgG) and its concentration is observed in human serum or plasma. RF value higher than 20 unit/milliliter (U/mL) is considered positive.

measure.title: Anti-cyclic Citrullinated Protein (Anti-CCP) antibodies
measure.description: Anti-CCP antibodies are auto antibodies (antibodies directed against 1 or more of an individual’s own proteins) that are frequently detected in the blood of rheumatoid arthritis participants. Anti-CCP antibodies value higher than 10 U/mL is considered positive.

measure.title: Anti-nuclear antibodies
measure.description: Anti-nuclear antibodies are auto antibodies directed against contents of the nucleus and are present in higher than normal numbers in autoimmune disease. Anti-nuclear antibodies value higher than 1:160 is considered positive.

measure.title: Anti-deoxyribonucleic Acid (Anti-DNA) antibodies
measure.description: Anti-DNA antibodies are auto antibodies directed against DNA and are present in higher than normal numbers in autoimmune disease. Anti-DNA antibodies value higher than 1:20 is considered positive.

measure.title: Duration of morning stiffness
measure.description: Duration of morning stiffness: Time elapsed when participant woke up in morning and was able to resume normal activities without stiffness in minutes. Increase in stiffness duration from baseline represented disease progression and/or joint worsening, no change represented halting of disease progression, and a decrease represented improvement.

measure.title: Stanford Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ)
measure.description: HAQ is a measure of functional limitations. Participants were rated on 4 point scale with scores: 0=no difficulty, 1=some difficulty, 2=much difficulty, 3=unable to do based on degree of difficulty experienced with 20 tasks grouped into 8 areas of dressing, rising, hygiene, reach, walking, eating, grip and activities. Average score range: 0 to 3.

measure.title: 36-Item Short-Form Health Survey (SF-36)
measure.description: SF-36 is a standardized survey evaluating 8 aspects of functional health and well being: physical and social functioning, physical and emotional role limitations, bodily pain, general health, vitality, mental health. The score for a section is an average of the individual question scores, which are scaled 0-100 (100=highest level of functioning).

measure.title: Disease duration
Number of tender joints
measure.description: The mean number of tender joints was evaluated based on the number of tender joints in a standard 28 joint count.

measure.title: Number of swollen joints (SJC)
measure.description: The mean number of swollen joints was evaluated based on the number of swollen joints in a standard 28 joint count.

measure.title: Percentage of participants given Disease Modifying Anti-Rheumatoid Drugs (DMARD)

outcome.title: Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR) at Month 3
outcome.description: ESR is a laboratory test that provides a non-specific measure of inflammation. The test assesses the rate at which red blood cells fall in a test tube. Normal range is 0-30 mm/hr. A higher rate is consistent with inflammation.
outcome.population: ITT population included all participants who received at least 1 dose of the study medication.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Anti-cyclic Citrullinated Protein (Anti-CCP) Antibodies at Month 3
outcome.description: Anti-CCP antibodies are auto antibodies (antibodies directed against 1 or more of an individual’s own proteins) that are frequently detected in the blood of rheumatoid arthritis participants. Anti-CCP antibodies value higher than 10 U/mL is considered positive.

measure.description: Anti-nuclear antibodies are auto antibodies directed against contents of the nucleus and are present in higher than normal numbers in autoimmune disease. Anti-nuclear antibodies value higher than 1:160 is considered positive.
measure.population: ITT population included all participants who received at least 1 dose of the study medication.

outcome.title: Duration of Morning Stiffness at Month 3
outcome.description: Duration of morning stiffness: Time elapsed when participant woke up in morning and was able to resume normal activities without stiffness in minutes. Increase in stiffness duration from baseline represented disease progression and/or joint worsening, no change represented halting of disease progression, and a decrease represented improvement.
outcome.population: ITT population included all participants who received at least 1 dose of the study medication.

outcome.title: Stanford Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ) Score at Month 3
outcome.description: HAQ is a measure of functional limitations. Participants were rated on 4 point scale with scores: 0=no difficulty (normal), 1=some difficulty (adequate), 2=much difficulty (limited), 3=unable to do based on degree of difficulty experienced with 20 tasks grouped into 8 areas of dressing, rising, hygiene, reach, walking, eating, grip and activities. The higher score reported by the participant for any component question of the 8 categories determines the score for that categories. Total score is divided for 8. Average score range: 0 (no difficulty) to 3 (unable to do).
outcome.population: ITT population included all participants who received at least 1 dose of the study medication.

outcome.title: 36-Item Short-Form Health Survey (SF-36) at Month 12
outcome.description: SF-36 is a standardized survey evaluating 8 aspects of functional health and well being: physical and social functioning, physical and emotional role limitations, bodily pain, general health, vitality, mental health. The score for a section is an average of the individual question scores, which are scaled 0-100 (100=highest level of functioning).
outcome.population: ITT population included all participants who received at least 1 dose of the study medication. Missing values were imputed using LOCF.

outcome.title: Direct Costs
outcome.description: Direct costs included all expenses requiring actual payment or time spent due to the disease itself or to disability.

outcome.title: Indirect Costs
outcome.description: Indirect costs represent the loss of resources as a consequence of work disability or unemployment.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Anti-tumor Necrosis Factor (Anti-TNF) Agents

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Protocol did not indicate primary or secondary endpoints and all determination of primary or secondary endpoints were arbitrary.
